explanation: The bug is in the walrus assignment line: it uses P - Q + d but should subtract d as well. Using + d produces the wrong value; I changed the + to - so p is computed as P - Q - d, which matches the intended subtraction of both Q and d from P.
fixed_code:
N, P, Q = map(int, input().split())
D = list(map(int, input().split()))

res = P

for d in D:
    if (p := P - Q - d) < res:
        res = p

print(res)
